source.raw_text:
[The Plank with Weighted Reach-Through is a dynamic core exercise strengthening your abs, obliques, shoulders, and back, challenging anti-rotation stability, balance, and overall core strength by dragging a dumbbell under your body from a high plank, requiring hip and torso stillness while moving the weight across your midline. [1, 2, 3]  
Muscles Worked: 

• Primary: Rectus Abdominis, Obliques, Transversus Abdominis (deep core). 
• Secondary: Shoulders (Deltoids), Upper Back (Lats, Traps), Glutes, Hip Flexors, Lower Back. [1, 2, 4, 5, 6]  

Movement Pattern: 

1. Starting Position: High plank (push-up position) with a dumbbell just outside one hand, body in a straight line from head to heels, core engaged. 
2. Reach & Drag: Reach with your opposite hand, grab the dumbbell, and drag it under your body to the other side. 
3. Stabilize: Maintain a strong plank; hips should stay level, avoiding excessive rocking or lifting. 
4. Return & Switch: Place the dumbbell down, return to the starting plank, then repeat on the other side, alternating hands. 
5. Focus: The movement emphasizes anti-rotation, forcing your core to work hard to prevent your hips and torso from twisting as the weight moves. [1, 2, 3, 5, 7]  

**Citations:**

[1] https://www.trainfitness.ai/exercises/plankReachThrough
[2] https://fitbod.me/exercises/plank-with-dumbbell-pull-through
[3] https://www.trainwell.net/exercises/dumbbell-plank-weight-drag-through
[4] https://support.runna.com/en/articles/6382899-plank-pull-through-exercise-tutorial
[5] https://generationiron.com/plank-pull-through-exercise-guide/
[6] https://www.shape.com/what-muscles-do-planks-work-8350322
[7] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iXtAv61NEIo
